Clubs and Activities

Bang for the buck
What to do for fun

Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

CSUF is a very safe campus and learning environment. The school has close ties with the city's police department who offer their services to the school daily and even have a headquarters on the campus.

With over thirty sororities and fraternities along with hundreds of culture, food, science, math and any club you can think of, CSUF has a club for every student. You can find these clubs in the quad area during the week promoting and advertising their club, making joining easier and more convenient.

CSUF has great performing and visual arts programs that attract aspiring actors, dancers, musicians, scenic designers, filmmakers and producers each year. Fullerton also has a competitive business department that appeal to aspiring entrepreneurs. The schools offers some of the best Kinesiology studies that bring in many aspiring physical therapists, sports doctors and talented athletes.
At every hour on the hour, a huge iron bell; which can not be seen, goes off and can be heard any where on campus and gives one a feeling that they are in the American Revolution.
CSUF has remained an affordable and competitive institution. Even with budget cuts and increased tuition, Fullerton remains to give each student the best education at the best price, always.

There are many clubs and social groups on campus that pertain to all interests and hobbies. Fullerton also has a massive recreational center with: gym, mountain climbing, swimming, indoor basketball courts and new sport's facilities. Fullerton also has an underground bowling alley with game room; that is a popular spot for students. About fifteen minutes off campus, students can escape to Disneyland/California Adventure Theme Parks. For those who stay in the vicinity of the campus, the city of Fullerton offers many shopping center, restaurants and various venues that are popular to the night-life crowd.

CSUF has many different eateries on campus. There is the the Titan Student Union; a food court offering favorites like; Panda Express, Baja Fresh, Round Table's Pizza and Juice It Up. There is also a Carl's' Jr. on campus along with Titan Express; a mini mart that is a quick stop for hungry students. For the students living on campus, there is the Gastronome; a buffet style cafeteria.
CSUF challenges their student; they care about teaching. With some of the best departments around, Fullerton is determined to teach students to master their desired craft.
Arrive everyday with your best effort and work ethics. There are wonderful staff and faculty but it is ultimately the student's job to learn and grow.

A well-rounded University that contours to every type of student and learning style. The numerous activities and vast diversity of the campus make CSUF a top school in the L.A./O.C. area. Those who get an opportunity to attend Fullerton, should definitely consider.
pageTitle: California State University-Fullerton (CSUF) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck All the schools within the CSU system are pretty affordable, but there have been huge budget cuts and tuition hikes. Within the last year, tuition has increased almost $1,000. Not only has tuition increased, but teachers are being told to take furlough 6 days a semester that will cut their salaries by 10%. Students are paying 30% more, but is receiving 10% less for their education because teachers don't have classes on their furlough days. Even with the tuition hikes, Cal State University, Fullerton is more affordable than other 4-year universities. Am enjoying being here Cal State University, Fullerton is a commuter school, therefore most of the students in class are there to get it done with so they can go home. There isn't much of a social aspect here and it's difficult to meet new friends. The school has apartment-style dorms that house only 800 students, which is only 2% of the student population. There are much more students that live off campus, but they are dispersed throughout the city. Meeting people in class is difficult and you have to make an effort to meet people- check out the clubs and student organizations on campus at the DiscoverFest held in the quad at the beginning of the semester, it will make your experience here more enjoyable.
